tweet.html: RT @US_AU: African Americans’ contributions to U.S. diplomacy began in the late 19th century, when abolitionists Ebenezer Bassett and, later, Frederick Douglass were appointed as Chiefs of Mission to Haiti and the Dominican Republic. bit.ly/3baYQfP #BlackExcellence #BHM2021
